Reviews.Title: Fantastic value!
Reviews.Author: M. Gauntt
Reviews.Content: I reasearched quite a bit before buying this TV. It is a great value. Looking at TVs on display in stores, other LCDs didn't have very dark blacks and a lot had those weird pixelly trails when there was fast motion. The 37HL67 doesn't have either of these problems. It has a great picture - bright, good color and contrast. The controls are easy to use. The picture and built in sound are great. I hooked up an old amplified antenna I had and the tuner got almost all of our local HDTV stations. I just ordered an antenna made for HDTV Terk HDTVa Indoor Amplified High-Definition Antenna for Off-Air HDTV Reception and expect that to work even better. In case you came across this in your search, the 37HL17 is the exact same model as this one, it just has a different number as it is usually shipped to a different type of retailer. All in all, I am very happy with this TV and would recommend it highly.The connections on the back:3 HDMI inputscoaxial input for cable/antennacomputer monitor VGA-type input2 sets of component video (3 phono/RCA type plugs)/stereo audio (2 phono plugs) inputs1 analog video (single yellow phono plug)/audio in with s-video option1 optical TOSLINK audio out1 main stereo (red/white phono plug) audio outone stereo audio in (red/white phono plug) for use with either the HDMI or computer monitor inA 2nd analog video/audio in on the side of the TV for a camcorder or whatever

Reviews.Title: Very good HDTV
Reviews.Author: B. Christensen
Reviews.Content: HD picture: 5 stars. The color and sharpness are about as good as any others (some being much more expensive) that I have looked at.SD digital picture: 4 stars. No HDTV displays SD extremely well, but the Regza does as good or better than most.SD analog picture: 4 stars. Of course not as impressive as digital, but I would expect that.Sound quality: 5 stars. I have external surround sound connected, but you don't really need it.User adjustments: 5 stars. This TV has a lot of settings for picture and sound, you can customize it exactly how you want it. We have digital HD satellite, and an outdoor antenna connected, and get a very good picture from both. I have only watched SD DVD's so cannot say much about that, but they are as good as any other SD content. Overall, I am very happy with this television, and cannot come up with any negatives. I would strongly consider buying a Toshiba again.MAY 08, 2008 - After almost 10 months, no problems, and we are still very satisfied with the Regza! The HD programs are fantastic, and standard digital is really good too, S.D. does vary from program to program, but that isn't the televisions fault.

Reviews.Title: Love it!
Reviews.Author: scargums
Reviews.Content: My dad was looking for a new TV, so we did a lot of research and landed on the Toshiba based on price vs brand quality/reliability.  Now that it is set up the thing looks fantastic and is clearly worth more than we paid for it.  Picture quality is superb, it took no time to set up, and we also have the comfort of owning a quality brand like Toshiba (between the two of us we own 3 other Toshiba TVs and they all look great and have lasted a long time)One thing that really stands out is how well it seems to handle standard def signals from satellite and DVDs, which is a real plus as he does not yet have a high def package.  The picture looks great for an LCD TV, and its easy to mess around with the settings like picture size and so forth to get it the way you like it, though honestly you may not change anything right out of the box.  We also tried an upconverting DVD player using HDMI, and the results, as expected, were beautiful.  Highly recommended!

Reviews.Title: beautiful picture; too bad it's broke
Reviews.Author: Boomerang86
Reviews.Content: I went from a 27" CRT to this 37HL67 and couldn't believe the clarity of HD!  This is a wonderful set with three HDMI inputs and many other options.  1080i/720p was fine for me since most cable HD is only up to 1080i anyway.Six weeks after delivery, two annoying defects appeared.  First, the TV stopped responding to the remote control after being switched off for a couple of hours or overnight; I can still turn it on using the buttons on the side of the chassis but it's a major PITA.  Mysteriously, the TV starts responding to the remote after warming up for 15-20 minutes.  Second (and even MORE annoying) is the random power cycling that happens during the first few minutes the TV is turned on; it takes about seven to eight seconds for a complete power cycle.  Having my programs interrupted several times in succession like that is NO FUN.Getting the TV repaired is turning into Mission:Impossible!  Toshiba directed me to a local authorized repair shop; they were decent over the phone but couldn't help me at all after a month of back and forth over the phone.  Now they say that their Toshiba FSE (field service engineer) tells them the needed part is NOT AVAILABLE!  I just sent a copy of my purchase receipt to Toshiba TACP and await a response as to whether THEY can either locate a part, or plan to replace my defective TV.I'm delaying any future purchase of Toshiba products until the successful outcome of this episode.  Hopefully yours won't develop a similar defect.

Reviews.Title: Almost perfect
Reviews.Author: Dpfender
Reviews.Content: After having done plenty of research, I ended up getting this model at an electronics store for less than it could be had for online. It was manufactured in April, and I bought it in May. It's done everything I'd hoped for and more. Using the digital tuner, it can pick up four of the five local channels in HD without a cable box by doing a cable scan. When I purchased it, I declined the 4(3)-year extended warranty because Consumer Reports said that there are very few repairs needed in the first year or two. There wasn't one mention of dead pixels. My chance to get the extended warranty would expire in 30 days, so when I noticed 2 dead (black) pixels on the 29th day, I went out and got the extra warranty because they (UE) provide better coverage than Toshiba would. The pixels don't bother me that much, but knowing it'll be less of a hassle to get it replaced if any more show up gives me peace of mind, despite it costing a couple hundred extra.

Reviews.Title: Great TV for the price
Reviews.Author: K. Tung
Reviews.Content: I bought the Toshiba 37HL67 to replace an older Sony Wega CRT TV in my bedroom, overall I am very happy with this TV.  Here are some PROs and Cons in my opinion:PROS:1. Very good HD image at my normal viewing distance (6ft. or more).2. Excellent SD image.  Better than comparable Sony units - These two items are based on Comcast Cable feed through component cables (they are short on HDMI interface converters here in Houston at this time).3. Rich feature set, many are quite useful.4. Very nice and clean look, doesn't have distracting light or overdone Logos.5. Useful and 'hand-friendly' remote.  Controls Comcast box well enough.6. Very good connectivity options.7. Well-built, feels solid.CONS:1. Sound quality is acceptable thought it could be better - probably constrained by the slim profile of the speaker area.2. Menu system is somewhat chaotic.  Can be better organized.3. Can not customize and save the pre-set picture modes such as 'Sport',  'Standard' and 'Movie' - I can do this on my Sony RPTV easily, and the  'Movie' mode is way too dim.There is no noticeable motion-blur, the video quality feels on a par with Sony or Samsung 720P LCD TV.  Sound is not as good as Sony but acceptable.For a home theater setup I would go with a 50-inch or bigger HDTV to get better visual impact and ease of surround sound setup.  But for HDTV experience, the Toshiba 37HL67 is a great buy.  One probably doesn't get a lot of bragging rights with it, but one sure can brag about having made a most sensible and practical choice while watching this TV.Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: Great Set
Reviews.Author: Stephan J. Gold
Reviews.Content: Amazing picture. I have two other 1o8oi sets, sony and JVC and the picture here is excellent. Even the analog stations look almost HD. Plenty of imputs for any purpose. Looks great. For the price, and even not considering price, highly recommended. Cudos to Toshiba.

Reviews.Title: great product
Reviews.Author: B. Connolly
Reviews.Content: Have this TV now for 5 or 6 weeks, together with a $100 sony upconverting dvd player and the picture is just beautiful (who needs blu-ray).Watching my old dvd's looks so different now with so much detail that couldn't be seen before. Was originally trying to get a 1080p but after some research into whats available right now with this screen size and also reliability ratings, I decided on the toshiba. My old toshiba was a great tv, I hope this one lasts as long. One minor issue I have is if you use a surge protector and turn it on before you try turning on the tv, then it sometimes takes 2 trys and/or a short wait before you can actually turn it on.  Overall, highly recommended (eagle shipping was a week late but I guess you can expect that)

Reviews.Title: FANTASTIC HDTV!
Reviews.Author: A. Orlando "License"
Reviews.Content: I've had this HDTV for about 3 months now and couldn't be any happier. I did alot of research and decided on the Toshiba 37hl67. This is the best decision I've ever made. My wife (who doesn't know anything about Tv's) loves this HDTV and now she thinks I'm a god! I bought a $100 upconverting SONY DVD player and the picture looks FANTASTIC! Best price, Best 37" HDTV for the money!! Don't be fooled by others.

Reviews.Title: Great TV for the money! Highly recommeneded!
Reviews.Author: Amir H. Hormati
Reviews.Content: This is my first LCD TV and I could be any happier. I have been looking at LCD from different companies, such as Samsung, Vizio, Sharp and Sony, for over 5 month, and I have been waiting for something like this. Before buying this TV, I'd looked at the reviews at Amazon, Cnet, Circuit City, and Newegg. Most of the reviwes are really positive. The reviews for this TV is even better than most of the more expensive Samsung and Sharp TVs. So, I bought it about 3 weeks ago and I am extremely happy with the quality of the TV. This TV has everything I want, great picture quality, good sound, great connectivity, ... . The price for this TV is also unbeatable at this time. I got for $899 from Circuit City. Amazon also sells it for about the same price, but I like the convenience of being able to return it to department store.

Reviews.Title: Very impressive
Reviews.Author: tk_seggel "Thomas"
Reviews.Content: This TV works very well, the picture is awesome when watching DVD (standard TV looks pretty bad but that is not the TVs fault). I have picked it based on comparing it live in an Electronics store (but then ordered it through Amazon). The black levels could be improved, as could be the viewing angle (basically, starting at around 30 degrees off center , the picture will start to wash out). These are, however, normal LCD traits.

Reviews.Title: EXCEPTIONAL PRICE / VALUE
Reviews.Author: POPS 5X
Reviews.Content: I purchased this set at H.H.Gregg in 4/07 for $1,080.  Now available at slightly lower prices.Connection to cable was simple.  Excellent owners manual to learn setups.Picture quality excellent on HD signals -- analog is good.  Bottom speakers produce exceptional sound.  And, the piano black set is extremely attractive.Drawback?  When turned on, the previously viewed channel appears quickly.  But, there is a 20-30 second delay until the remote control will change channels or volume.Very pleased, and highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: A Remarkable Set
Reviews.Author: Bothvar "Those without swords can still die o...
Reviews.Content: Like some other reviewers, I bought Toshiba for the bedroom; like many of them I was surprised at just how good this simple unit is.Forget the bells and whistles of 1080P, 120hz refresh rate, deep color, all of the little hooks to get you to blow your dough on features you can't use or can't see. The picture quality is amazing, certainly the equal of the set's precedessor, a Sceptre Naga 1080P, and, for what it does, a decent second to my main display a Sony SXRD. Sound is fine, especially dialogue; if you're listening to music or special effects obviously you're going to hook the Toshiba up to an external system.I am fortunate to have Verizon FIOS which sends a fine SD picture that looks remarkable on the Toshiba. For sporting events on non-HD channels, like Fox Soccer World or ESPNU, the theatrewide2 zoom fills the screen without noticeable degradation.One reviewer objected to the Film picture setting- try using it on an HD movie- much more cinematic than Standard.Two considerations, one of them obvious. A 2:35 movie- think any spectacle-won't give you the involvement you'll get on a larger screen. But you know that already. The other, probably a minor issue- fixed audio outputs only. You absolutely can't send audio to a power amplifier, and a non-remote integrated amp can't be adjusted from your viewing position unless you've got expandable arms. I make do with the set's speakers for TV and the pause button on my DVD player. I'm not going to load up the bedroom with a new receiver.Don't compare this unit to some super plasma- keep in its price class and intended function and you'll be happy I was looking for adequacy, I found excellence.

Reviews.Title: Toshiba 37" Regza
Reviews.Author: DS_Ohio
Reviews.Content: This is my first HD television, and its selection was largely based on the size of an entertainment center I wanted to keep in my living room. I have had the Toshiba for one month, now. I have digital cable service from the local provider, and have an HD Cable box connected to the television with an HDMI cable. I read many reviews of many manufacturer's brands before choosing the Toshiba. My living room is average to small in size and probably receives more sunlight than average. This unit was an upgrade from a 27" Sony CRT. I can't find anything I dislike about the TV. The remote is plain, but with cable service, you're pretty much forced to use whatever remote they provide with the cable box. Sound quality seems fine. Angle-viewing is fine. Image brightness seems fine. The colors seem larger-than-life to me, but I haven't yet bothered to tone them down. I haven't seen the motion-blurring or fuzzy pictures of old programming that I've read can be problems. All image qualities in my opinion are improved over the CRT. The TV obediently jumps from 480 to 720 to 1080 resolutions when the box says to. I would recommend this television to a friend.

Reviews.Title: Excellent TV, including for gamers.
Reviews.Author: M. A. Gonzalez
Reviews.Content: I spent much time searching through televisions, looking for ones with Game Mode or ones known for no lag. I was a bit unsure how this television would perform, never mind that it had Game Mode. But I am pleased to say it functions well. Playing Final Fantasy on the PS2 or Zelda on a GameCube has been a breeze, just as every game on the Xbox 360. If you are looking for a television that will work well with games that need fast timing, this is an excellent choice.Picture is another place this television stands out. Even with just standard satellite the picture comes in extremely well. Then when you move on to DVD's, the picture is outstanding. The sound on the other hand, isn't the best but it could be worse. However if you have surround sound, you won't need to worry about this. Luckily for me, I do have surround sound, which eliminates this problem.Overall, I do highly recommend this HDTV for someone looking for a good brand, a great HDTV but at a decent price that doesn't break the bank.

Reviews.Title: A Great Buy
Reviews.Author: Christopher Hernandez
Reviews.Content: I just graduated college and needed a television that was nice to watch and also something that made my Playstation 3 shine and this is it. I had researched TV sets for months and I really like Samsung but I found the price of them to be a little...much. Sony is nice but the models that I could afford had poor grainy pictures and there just wasn't enough for me to justify the higher end/price tag models.I had come across the Toshiba 37HL67 by accident on Tiger Direct for $699 and jumped at the deal. The picture quality on this set is amazing, Call of Duty 4: Modern Warfare looks really nice and Blu-ray's version of Ratatouille looks even better in High Def. My favorite thing is that there is no blurring effect (you know the one where it can't process fast moving objects).I don't have much to say about the sound though, I have it hooked to a surround sound system.This is the best set that you can buy if you are under a budget.

Reviews.Title: Great choice!
Reviews.Author: John Saylers
Reviews.Content: I did a lot of research before selecting this TV. It delivers! Here's what I like best about it:-Sturdy stand (important if you have active little ones)-Great Standard Definition picture (I can't fathom paying a ton for a TV that only looks good in HD, when most of what you watch is not in HD).-HD picture is amazing, of course.-Easy setup, just connected it and looked great right out of the box.-Sound quality is great.Only con is it takes 6 to 9 seconds to come on when you turn it on (this may be a regular LCD TV thing, as this is the only one I've owned).Comes with a 1 year warranty. I called Mastercard and they extend it to 2 years for free. Don't buy a ridiculous unnecessary extra warranty!Protected it with a Belkin Pure AV Home Theater surge protector.

Reviews.Title: JUST RECEIVED AND LOVE IT.
Reviews.Author: Paba "electronicnutt"
Reviews.Content: I just received this TV yesterday and set up was a breeze.  Hooked everything up, turned it on and that was it.  Beautiful picture.  I also purchased an up-converting DVD player.  I was a bit skeptical about this but the picture was awesome.  It definitely did what it said it would.  I am having Direct Tv coming today to install HD dish and receiver.  I will let you know more as time goes by.  I would also like to add that my experience with the site HIDEF where I purchased this TV was absolutely awesome.  The price is very competitive and customer service is outstanding.  I highly recommend HIDEF.

Reviews.Title: Great TV, some things to note about delivery/inputs/outputs
Reviews.Author: NoMore Norton "NoMore"
Reviews.Content: I have had this TV for almost 2 months. The TV itself is fantastic! I went from a 27" SDTV (using Dish Network) to this model with Dish HD and an up-converting DVD player. I also upgraded our audio receiver at the same time. I compared this set to an LG set (similar size) and went with this set (I thought the picture was better, I have also had very good luck with Toshiba products). The picture quality is excellent for HD and also for SD channels as well. There are plenty of input connections for everything you can think of. I also have my PC running through this set (DVI output on PC to HDMI on TV) and games look great as well. The audio from the TV sounded fine to me until I hooked up the digital audio system; I now use the digital audio receiver (5.1 speaker setup) 99% of the time as the 5.1 channel sound is significantly better than the TV sound output.Some points to note:a) The "white-glove" delivery service consisted of bringing the box into the house. The guy grumbled when he was asked to unpack the TV.b)I debated getting my satellite programming upgraded to HD. I am very glad that I did; there are quite a few channels that are unique to HD programming and the quality (picture/sound) is excellent. I didn't see the need for a 1080p TV since the satellite broadcasts are only 720p/1080i, I wasn't planning on getting an HD DVD/Blu-Ray player and the size of the set did not warrant the extra money for 1080p.c)To get the full digital 5.1 audio effect you must have a digital audio receiver PLUS you must connect each digital device (satellite box, DVD player) directly to the audio receiver. This TV only accepts PCM audio input from the HDMI cables. There is a digital out from the TV but it will not pass a digital 5.1 audio signal from the HDMI through (only PCM). The audio receiver I purchased only has digital audio connections (not HDMI connections) so I had to get a digital optical cable for the satellite receiver digital out and a coaxial cable for the DVD player digital out.d)I purchased an up-converting DVD player; I cannot tell the difference (I still have my old DVD player hooked up to the HD set). Maybe for larger sets that are 1080p the up-conversion may be worth it?e)Think about what cables you need and buy them from Amazon. All the retail stores charge high prices for cables which are not worth the extra cost.f)I bought component cables for the Wii, some games do look better at the higher resolution if the higher resolution was supported (only one game looked "blocky" but it was a third-party lousy game anyway).

Reviews.Title: Great value for a good tv!
Reviews.Author: K. Reagan
Reviews.Content: We have owned this for about 6 months now and haven't had any problems.  THe picture is beautiful, can look a bit pixelized if your too close but I do believe this TV is meant to be viewed at around 10 - 15 feet away.  The sound is nice, could be a bit more powerful but most people (including us) go through a stereo these days.We have digital cable and it looks great, DVD's great also.  Those are really the only two we've tried on it, I would imagine analog cable wouldn't look too bad nor would VHS tapes.  It does take a bit long to power up, but no more than 30 seconds if I had to guess, it'd be more like 20.  We bought this on sale when it was just 800/850ish which is an amazing value compared to other LCD's of it's size.  We did order it through amazon with the extended warrenty, which I suggest.  It was delivered rather quickly and amazon hires out a company to come delivery and set it up for you.Set up looked easy to me, and I probably will be able to do it again by myself easy.  There are enough inputs for our cable, dvd/vhs player and PS2 and then some.  I did my research and I couldn't be happier with what we paid!

Reviews.Title: Toshiba 37 in. is great TV, good price.
Reviews.Author: Carol Anne "cam"
Reviews.Content: I researched this and other 37 in. TV's before purshasing. It was easy to set up, has beautiful picture. color is great.  It took me a while to absorb all the info in the manual.  But it is everything I was looking for and more.  I have my surround sound w/ digital audio receiver/DVD player connected.  I found out I needed an Optical audio cable to enable my TV to play the TV programs through my surround sound.  My old tv didn't require that.  But I figured it out after really studying the manual w/ tv and DVD player.  I was so pleased and the sound is awesome!!!  Also I connected another DVD player w/HDMI connection so I can play my vcd's that I make with my photography hobby.  And they are beautiful too.  So this has been a wonderful unit for me and I am a 64 yr. old lady, and put this together myself.  Just needed a little muscle to get my old very heavy tv. out.I would highly recommend this  product....it is great!!!cam/Dav. Ia.

Reviews.Title: Toshiba Regza 37HL67 LCD HD TV
Reviews.Author: Richard C. Blum "Richie The Raider"
Reviews.Content: We purchased two of these Toshiba LCD TVs after I spent several months researching this brand/model and at Consumer Reports. They rated it as a superior set for quality, reliability, ease of use and overall quality of the picture and sound. We got rid of a JVC and an old Toshiba analog set in favor of this model. All I can say is that I am still astonished and pleasantly surprised at the crystal clear picture and sound! It is so clear compared to the reasonably good picture and sound we had on the old analog tube sets. And, we couldn't be happier with Amazon's good service, discount price and the on schedule delivery of our order which was free. Amazon and Toshiba deserve our five-star rating for this entire transaction.

Reviews.Title: Excellent HLCD HDTV and perfect size!
Reviews.Author: PBelt71
Reviews.Content: This LCD TV has an excellent picture and the sound is very good as well. I bought this TV about 3 or 4 months ago, and recently got the HD package with DirecTv and love it! The difference between the non HD channels and the HD channels is amazing, especially with football and movies. You can't beat the price of this TV for what you get and it looks like it has come down about $50 since I bought it as well. The size is very good for those that are used to a 32" TV as the measurements seem to be less than those on a tube TV. It doesn't seem that much larger than a 32" TV, but the picture seems quite a bit bigger since it is 16:9 widescreen. I would recommend it for anyone who doesn't want to spend $1500 for a TV on some of the brands that think they are better and charge $500 extra for the name.

Reviews.Title: Love this TV!
Reviews.Author: M. Thompson
Reviews.Content: I love the TV, the price and the speedy, careful and free shipping. I am so happy with the picture, I don't plan on getting a cable box. The HD is terrific.

Reviews.Title: Nothing Short of Spectacular!
Reviews.Author: Jim Allen "Jim Allen"
Reviews.Content: It was time to upgrade a 1991 vintage TV but we had to do it on a budget and get something we'll probably have as long as that old RCA. The Toshiba filled that bill nicely, along with a few others, but it was the Amazon deal that made us push the button here. I have nothing but nice things to say about the TV. It's Kinda like climbing out of the mail compartment of a Curtiss Jenny and into first class aboard a 747. The difference in picture quality from our old set is dazzling. What's not to like? I'm sure we'll eventually discover something we don't particularly like, but for now the honeymoon is still hot and heavy. There have been no problems at all with the set and operating it has been straightforward but more complex than our old set. Dredging deep, about the only negative thing I can say about this transaction is regarding the delivery. The gent that came to set the unit up was a little shy of training on the product but he was also friendly, courteous, willing to work... and smart enough to follow the set up instructions. We could have purchased this TV at any of a dozen nearby discount stores but it was the Amazon deal and service that tipped our choice in their direction.

Reviews.Title: Toshiba lcd tv
Reviews.Author: Boom Dog
Reviews.Content: We bought this as a Christmas present to ourselves. Our old tv was about 15 years old. Great picture, easy to program. A lot more to setup than the old one! Glad we purchased this tv. Did some research and this was one of the higher rated ones. Beach camera had a great price and using Amazon.com even a better deal.

Reviews.Title: Very pleased with Toshiba REGZA
Reviews.Author: Peter J. Dignan "Founder and President, Proto...
Reviews.Content: We bought this based on a recommendation in Consumer Reports.  Was easy to set up.  Picture is very good.  Easy to use.  Can't think of anything we don't like about this set.

Reviews.Title: Picture looks great no matter what you throw at it!
Reviews.Author: clexman
Reviews.Content: Analog SD, digital SD, & High Def pictures all look great!  My Nintendo Wii & older cheapo DVD player both put up a fantastic 480p picture using component cables.I also watched some TV shows I missed on the CW & NBC by connecting my laptop to the set via s-video and playing them from their websites.  I couldn't tell the difference between the shows playing off my laptop and watching them live on digital cable.I recommend the TV to anyone.

Reviews.Title: Very happy with this
Reviews.Author: BigJ
Reviews.Content: After seeing this at Circuit City I checked Amazon and found the price MUCH lower.  The picture was so much better than others in the store, so ordering it here was a pretty easy decision to make.  After a great experience with Eagle, Amazon's shipper, and hooking it up I was amazed at the quality for the price I paid. I was anxious about dealing with delivery, but having someone bring it to my house and help unpack it was less stressful than other TVs I've bought where I had to load a big box in my car, haul it in the house, etc.I use mine to watch digital channels with the QAM tuner.  In addition to the great picture (especially on HD channels) it has great channel handling and flips through channels reasonably quickly.  Overall I'm very happy with this TV and the Amazon experience.

Reviews.Title: Great HDTV at a Great price.
Reviews.Author: J. Grindstaff
Reviews.Content: I researched for weeks different LCD TV's and Plasma TV's and I finally went with the Toshiba REGZA 37HL67 37" 720p LCD HDTV.  It has three HDMI outlet's and all the other connection's you might need.  It took me less than 30 minutes from box to TV stand to set up and the owner's manual was very easy to understand.  Setting the picture mode was quite easy and learning the remote control functions was easy as well.  Some reviews on here have complained about the mode select switch because they say it's easy to accidentally switch between TV, Cable/Sat, Aux 1, and Aux 2, I haven't had that problem at all plus I use my cable box remote control more than I do the remote that came with the TV.  The picture is just amazing and the sound is good, I have it hooked up to my stereo system so when I have that on it really rocks. I love the different Pic modes, watching the Laker's in "Sports Mode" is awesome and I adjusted the settings in my "Preference" so when my kids watch Sponge Bob the colors look fantastic.  I think for the price of this HDTV it's a really great deal and you can't go wrong with Toshiba.

Reviews.Title: TV only lasted 3 years!
Reviews.Author: J. A. De OSSA Jr.
Reviews.Content: What else can I say?  I'm shopping for a new TV already. This is the shortest-lived TV I've ever owned in my over 50 years!  I'm staying away from any Toshiba branded product after this experience.

Reviews.Title: unreliable color quality
Reviews.Author: James Drifke "jd"
Reviews.Content: Less than 3 years old and the color is saturated to a point it is unwatchable. Out of warranty and cost of repair approaches a new unit. Very disappointing.

Reviews.Title: Side by Side vs Aquos 1080P and Regza Won!!!
Reviews.Author: Twosome Ts "T&T;"
Reviews.Content: My husband does the research and was going top buy a 37" Sharp Aquos 1080P until he and I compared the two pictures with the same input (even alternated the connectors) and the Toshiba beat it every time for sharpness (no pun intended), color, clarity and the capture and display of movement, (pucks, etc during a game that was also viewed during the demo).It was only a little bit less than the Sharp Aquos and 1080P seemed the better investment prior to the side by side comparison where the Regza never had any fuzziness and the Aquos did.After to approximately two years, we have never had a problem and our Toshiba Regza picture is still as clear and sharp as when we brought it home.  There are several Toshiba TVs out there and I can only speak to the Regza models which I am of the impression have a superior engine to their other Toshiba models.Would we buy another one again, darn straight we would.

Reviews.Title: Fantastic set - no complaints !!!
Reviews.Author: Kal "Kal"
Reviews.Content: Bought this a few months ago - tinkered around with all the settings - hooked it up to my PS3(80gb model - the best!!) - used DVD & blu-ray calibration disks to fine-tune and after endless hours of experimentation the results are satisfying - if not spectacular.1) Connections - has more than what you might normally need, unless you are a hardcore techie setting up a really hifi home-theater setup. Go thru the specs2) Audio - from a layman's perspective(& I would consider myself slightly up the curve compared to a layman), audio is excellent. Bass is terrific - (pseudo)surround-sound works like magic with TV programs that broadcast in surround sound - it is not tinny to hear. Supports optical digital out which might be downmixed to dolby pro-logic. That should not matter in case you are feeding audio from your sources to your home-theater receiver. IMP NOTE - if you hook-up your AV source to this TV via HDMI, audio is downmixed to 2-ch LPCM. (Note that LPCM is pure uncompressed, better than compressed formats like dolby digital or DTS, channel for channel - of course, this is 2-ch so again recommendation is to connect your AV source to your home theater receiver).3) Video - this is spectacular. This TV is billed as a 1080i but make no mistake it accepts full 1080p inputs. The result (my viewing distance is around 8 ft) is indistinguishable from an equivalent 1080p (I spent tons of hours in research and comparison). Colors, detail & sharpness are ourstanding when watching BD movies from my PS3 hooked up via HDMI. Absolutely no complaints.IMP NOTE - it is essential that you spend time calibrating all the myriad pic options to suit you best. I found that if I started by setting all options "dead center or middle" and then tweaking each one as high as my eye found pleasing, with final fine-tuning touches by using calibration DVDs, results were spectacular. Spend time on these calibrations and your labors will be rewarded.I DO NOT have HD TV transmission - have regular DirecTV but the results are still VERY GOOD. Yes, there is a slight smudginess etc(will be there when you watch regular transmission on ANY HDTV) but this one likely deals with it in the best possible way. The results are as if you are watching the best quality VHS tape and oh yes - the south asian channels that I get - for some reason look almost HD-like on this TV.I got it on sale for 839/- and in its size-class this is probably the best one for the price, still!!!! Go TOSHIBA REGZA!!!

Reviews.Title: Great product
Reviews.Author: Michael Reif
Reviews.Content: This television came with rave reviews. When I received the item it worked to perfection and the HD is phenomenal. For a 720 37" tv it is worth the price, especially while it's discounted. No reason to pay hundreds more for minute differences

Reviews.Title: Great Deal!
Reviews.Author: John Doe
Reviews.Content: I have only had the TV for about a week, but i have no negative comments so far. Very nice pic and sound. This is my 1st step into HD, so I have nothing to compare to. I passed on the warranty since it would be over $100 for only 1 yr. VERY fast shipping (if ordered directly from Amazon). I recommend paying the extra few bucks for Amazon price so it is easier to get help if you should need it.  The CEVA(formerly EAGLE) website that Amazon uses, does not update correctly. I picked up my TV from the Wharehouse 6 days ago, and the CEVA site still has NO INFO AT ALL on my package. But on a good note...I live only 350 miles from HEBRON, KY (where it shipped from). It arrived at the Wharehouse 3 days later! (est date on amazon read 10 days)  I will update this later if anything comes up....Right now, Very satisfied!!

Reviews.Title: My First HDTV
Reviews.Author: Ryan J. Allison
Reviews.Content: I'm very satisfied with my Toshiba Regza 37".  Amazon sold and shipped it, and the whole process went smoothly.  The TV takes only a few minutes to set up, and navigation of the menu is very easy.  The picture is amazingly clear, and the sound is actually rather good!  It looks great with a XBox 360 hooked up; I can finally see everything that is meant to be seen in-game.  Even hooking up a VCR (to watch some History Channel Color of War tapes) looks superb!  The TV picture options make the 1940's color footage look like it was shot to fit the wide-screen.  I researched a lot of other HDTVs, and couldn't help but land on this one because of the overall quality and price.  It's a great looking TV that's perfect for the first time buyer!

Reviews.Title: Even better than expected!
Reviews.Author: Karl R. Schneider
Reviews.Content: We are somewhat surprised and extremely pleased with this TV.  My roommate is a Dish network and Directv installer and updates people with new HD sets every day and he believes our 37HL67 has as good a picture as -any- other of any size or any brand that he has seen!  It was quick and easy to set up and it performs great.  The sound from its small speakers is marginal but nobody in their right mind would fail to connect this great video machine to a quality sound system...which is easy to do and rounds it out nicely.  So far we love it!

Reviews.Title: Bad design
Reviews.Author: Esther "esther"
Reviews.Content: I've had this TV almost three months. I got it about $150 less than Amazon's lowest price.The TV looks great in my small apartment, almost too big. The picture is great-I'm using it with DirectTv HD service. But the one thing that bothers me about the TV is the stand/base. You have to screw the base on manually. After having the TV for a few weeks the TV started to wobble. We had to take it down and tighten the screws, same thing happened a few week after that. My husband used both a hand and power screw diver to ensure a tight fit- but to no avail. The bad base would stop me from buying the set again

Reviews.Title: Beware
Reviews.Author: J. Lee
Reviews.Content: I bought this TV based on all of the great reviews here on Amazon, on top of the amazing deal.  Can't beat the free tax right? Well, if I knew of all the problems that it would create beforehand, I would have forked over the extra $200-300 and purchase this in a store.First of all, Amazon ships this TV via Eagle which is probably the worst shipping provider out there.  They are unbelievably unprofessional over the phone and they didn't even provide the white glove service that was supposed to be included.  I guess this was my mistake for overseeing this part, but they still should have offered.  Anyways, I unpacked the TV (which is beautiful by the way) only to find out that the screen didn't even produce any picture!  I heard the audio just fine, but other than that, I got a TV that just didn't work.  I even had a repair man open it up to diagnose it and I was stunned when he told me that the entire circuit board was corrupt and that he would need to replace the entire thing.  I decided to just return it instead of replacing it since it was such a headache to deal with (I had to talk to Amazon almost 6 times just to get this completed).  I ended up buying another TV brand at the store and am more than happy with my decision.Maybe I got a lemon of the bunch or Eagle just didn't pay attention to the "fragile" note on the box when they were delivering it.  Either way, I will never buy anything online like this again.  My advice is to beware purchasing anything online that is expensive and that can be a headache to handle with in terms of the logistics.

Reviews.Title: did not last long
Reviews.Author: Helmut Kade "bicman"
Reviews.Content: After about 3 weeks and a very good performance picture wise thevideo went out and I had no problem to return it to Amazon .Helmut Kade

Reviews.Title: Great Flat Screen
Reviews.Author: Loyal user
Reviews.Content: Finally, I can review a product I am happy with overall in price, shipping, and timeliness of receipt without any problems.  Great overall picture with good clarity, and I really enjoy having a 37" screen. However, I have 2 issues:  1 is that when showing videos on this television, they are very fuzzy and the picture comes out quite badly.  Perhaps I need to read up on screen readjustments for videos, and 2, the volume control seems to not work properly.  At 45, it just seems normally loud, but doesn't get as loud as I think it should.  If I were to put my 27"  Sony that is downstairs at 45, I'd blast the roof off!

Reviews.Title: SATISFIED
Reviews.Author: Satisfied
Reviews.Content: Satisfied so far, have had it in operation for 3 weeks. No major problems.Have to get used to the delay between channels when you use the remote to enter new channel, not the channel up or down button. Not a biggy. Also the only screen that you can see the ticker tape on the bottom is the full screen. If you use the theater 2 or 3 the top of the heads goes away. Just a little problem not expressed in adds or brouchers.The TV arrived on the day the shipping info said it would, took 10 days as it came from Dallas,Tx to Seattle,Wa to Yakima,Wa to Cle Elum,Wa, and no broken parts!!  Plugged it in, hooked up the anolog cable and great picture.

Reviews.Title: Short and (not)Sweet Review for Toshiba 37 HL 67.
Reviews.Author: R. E. WORSLEY
Reviews.Content: One of the few items that was not purchased through Amazon.com, but locally, for over $1,000. TV set was put in service in July 2007 and performed perfectly with beautiful picture and decent sound. About 2 months ago it started losing the video when changing channels using the cable converter. Power plug to TV had to be unplugged and plugged in to get picture back. This is happening with increasing frequency and soon expect the set to fail for good. Not a recommended product, in spite of it's still excellent picture and sound quality. R.E.W.UPDATE: March 14, 2012. This Toshiba TV started to lose the video almost daily with every back and forth change from HD to SD channels. Seeing that it was only doing this on channel changes with the cable box, which had been recently replaced with a newer model, I discussed it with a Comcast tech and he advised changing my cable input on the TV from HDMI to Component. This is labeled, "ColorStream HD-1" (or 2) on this particular set.It may have been that the changes to the incoming signal from the cable box was triggering a shut down safety circuit that protected the screen. All I know is, it has been 3 or 4 days now of intentional switching back and forth between HD & SD channels to torture test the different connection used, and there has not been one "blackout" yet.  Will I change my 2 star rating for this set? No. This problem should not have occurred with so many different sets. Had it been trouble free, I would rate it at 4 to 5 stars for picture and sound quality.As far as Toshiba products in general go, I have a Toshiba DVD/VHS player - recorder and a Toshiba laptop computer and have been satisfied with them all, so far. I am looking forward to a few more years of trouble-free service from this TV, also. If this update does not get another "update" then consider the problem solved, at least for this particular set. I have no way of determining whether the "problem" lies with the HDMI output of the cable box or the input of my TV set. As it stands now, "If It Aint Broke,Don't Fix It" sounds like my motto for the time being.  R.E.W.UPDATE - September 3, 2012 :  So far, so good. The old Toshiba TV is still working OK since changing the hook-up. Other than this "problem", I would have probably given this set 4 or 5 stars. Excellent picture and very good sound.  R.E.W.

Reviews.Title: Wonderful set, but
Reviews.Author: Anonymous
Reviews.Content: You can get it for less at a retail store. I paid $799 for this in Spring 2007 at my local Costco.. Circuit City and Best Buy wanted $1300!While researching the set, I compared it (at Circuit City) to a Sony Bravia sitting next to it. Picture settings were the same and they were running the same feed.. the 37HL67 blew the Bravia away. And the fact that I could get it for almost $600 less, coupled with 3 HDMI when most sets this size only had 2 made it an easy purchase.Standard def is as good as it can be. HD varies by channel and program, something you'll notice once you start watching programming.Hockey and Basketball look GREAT, football and baseball.. look better on a plasma. PS3/XBOX 360/Wii all look amazing, as do Blu-ray movies.Def. a worthwhile buy, but shop around and try to get a better price!

Reviews.Title: A bargain - Great with HD signal, only so-so with non-HD
Reviews.Author: Traveler
Reviews.Content: I bought this TV back in Dec. 2007 as a gift for my older parents.  They've used it daily ever since.Before purchasing this model I found a professional review that stated that the HD quality was more than acceptable for this model (keep in mind it's 720p), but that non-HD digital and analog signals were some of the worst you'll find in this price range.  I know, you buy a TV like this for watching HD.  Problem is, you don't always receive HD.Before I bought my parents an upcoverting DVD player they used the regular player for this TV and it was just horrible.  The picture was worse than what they had with the older analog set.  Rushed out and bought the new DVD player.  That problem was fixed.They receive their digital TV over antenna.  Keep in mind that on antenna you can get three signals - analog (which disappears in 2009), digital (regular signal for lack of another term) and HD.  Since analog is going the way of the dodo there's no need to address that.  However, there are plenty of times that the digital signal is not in HD.  When that happens, this TV's picture is kind of disappointing.  Not horrible, no, but if you're stuck without an HD signal long enough it will make you wonder why you spent so much money.Keep in mind that there are digital TVs that do handle non-HD signals quite well - but you have to find the professional technical reviews out there to find out which ones they are.This might sound like I'm bashing this TV, but I don't intend to.  It was worth the money.  Just buyer beware.  Buy this if you know you're going to receive an HD signal on a regular basis.  If not, you might want to look for a different model.

Reviews.Title: Great quality for the price.
Reviews.Author: Chapwoman
Reviews.Content: I have had this TV for about 5 months (yes, I used my tax rebate).  I was lucky and found it on sale as an end of line since the new ones were coming out.  I had gone to the store planning to buy the newest Toshiba 37" (not Regza) but got this one instead as it was exactly the same for less money.  I love it!  I had upgraded from a 21" CRT so it was a huge improvement.  I find the picture quality, sound and menus to be very good.  My only complaint is when I watch DVDs I have to turn the sound way up, but this is probably not really an issue with the TV itself.  I researched the LCD market heavily before I bought and I believe I made the best choice for me.  I highly recommend this TV (and Toshiba in general) as a great choice for a great price.

Reviews.Title: Best TV ever
Reviews.Author: Richard Iverson
Reviews.Content: Great picture.  Excellent white glove delivery.  It was so good that I bought a 2nd one exactly like it for our 2nd bedroom.

Reviews.Title: Badboy
Reviews.Author: PB
Reviews.Content: Works great on the xbox and doubles up as a monitor for my laptop. Added a wireless keyb and mouse and now the laptop is a media center!Bonus!Max res seems to b only 1024x768 but clarity is excellent.

Reviews.Title: Very Good Value for a 37" LCD
Reviews.Author: Michael Heartwell "Mike"
Reviews.Content: Good service from shipping company.  Product was easy to set up and use out of the box.  Excellent features, and appearance.  Picture quality very good.  I notice a slight blurr, every now and then, as an image moves on the screen, as if part of the image starts to move slightly before the rest of the image.  Not too bad, though.  Overall very good picture quality.  Very satisfied with this purchase for the price, and would recommend.

Reviews.Title: Good quality LCD TV
Reviews.Author: DizyDazz "DizyDazz"
Reviews.Content: This is a superb 720p LCD TV. The picture quality is excellent for a 720p TV, especially when viewing movies with an HD DVD player. I have no complaints and I highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: Satisfied customer
Reviews.Author: Leo L. Van Sambeek "SD rancher"
Reviews.Content: We are satisfied that we received just what we expected based on the descriptions and specifications for the Toshiba TV. We had no problems with the setup and wiring to our satellite receiver and DVD player. We have not been able to get the Toshiba remote control to operate the satellite receiver -- but that might not even be possible. All in all 100% satisfaction.

Reviews.Title: Love my Toshiba
Reviews.Author: Catlover
Reviews.Content: I've had my Toshiba REGZA now for about 2 weeks and I have no regrets about my purchase.  I was tired of moving my blunderbust of a 32" analog TV and was ready for an LCD.  I purchased a 15" Toshiba this summer for my bedroom and was quite pleased with the picture.  The picture on this 37" REGZA is amazing.  The price on Amazon was better than the local stores plus the shipping and handling was free.  What more could I ask for....a fantastic TV for a great price delivered right to my door!

Reviews.Title: Excellent TV for the price!
Reviews.Author: Victor M. Nicolini
Reviews.Content: Great picture. Easy to set up. I couldn't find a better deal anywhere, and I've looked. For a 720p, it does fine on the 1080p broadcasts.

Reviews.Title: Excellent buy, worth the money
Reviews.Author: Sharon
Reviews.Content: I love it!! No problems whatsoever so far. Excellent picture, sound could be better, but what the heck. I got the fastest shipping in the history of my purchases at Amazon.

Reviews.Title: Toshiba REGZA 37HL67 37" 720p LCD HDTV
Reviews.Author: William F. Hossler
Reviews.Content: TV arrived ahead of schedule, although the tracking of the shipment was awful.  So far the Tv is great, no problems to date.

Reviews.Title: Great picture
Reviews.Author: Timothy B. Shull
Reviews.Content: Love it, love it, love it!  Great price and great picture.  Easy to use remote and a very nice television for our small media room off the kitchen.  The Super Bowl looked great as we had the HD satellite to watch it on.Great price and great picture for the money.  I have several Sharp LCD televisions.  They have a better picture, not much better, but you cannot beat this price for the quality LCD you are getting.  I have shopped around for years and this is a steal!

Reviews.Title: Solid TV
Reviews.Author: W. Bussone
Reviews.Content: I have no complaints. It looks nice, it works well, it has plenty of connectors. It doesn't play nice with the Onkyo's HDMI port because the Onkyo doesn't pass-through DRM controls, but that's been it as far as the issues.Yes, the remote is less than stellar, but I've certainly seen worse.

Reviews.Title: Took a chance --- Great choice!
Reviews.Author: Ercillor
Reviews.Content: I think that the other reviewers have said it all...We wanted a 37" flat screen TV which would fit into the space recently vacated by our old "friend" of many years -- a Panasonic 27" CRT based television. The Toshiba filled the bill and, thus far, has been delivering beautiful performance. There may be more advanced TV's out there but I -- and most others -- would probably not be able to detect the difference.I would have liked to buy an American made TV but NAFTA has sent all of those manufacturing sites -- along with their accompanying jobs -- out of the country. The Toshiba will have to do until, someday, this nation gets back on its feet.

Reviews.Title: Great TV for the Price
Reviews.Author: Jonathan Nicholson
Reviews.Content: I recently replaced my TV's in my home because of the upcoming digital tuner requirement and just to get more up to date.  This TV replaced a 150lb 32" Sony tube TV.  There was nothing wrong with the Sony, I recommend them, I got the Sony 46" W3000 series for my living room.  Also a wonderful TV.  But for the bedroom, 37" is all that is needed, and I was not going to spend extra for a 1080 for a TV in the bedroom.  So I did my research and read my reviews, which, by the way, are very helpful at times. So anyway, back to the TV, wonderful picture, and the sound is also all that is necessary for its use, no complaints about that.  The only thing that I do not like is that when you set a channel to we wide (in whatever selection of wide you choose), it does not save it that way when you come back to that channel after going to another.  Other than that, I do recommend this TV.  And the stories are true about getting your credits if the price drops within the 30 days, just call them at the time it is at that price and you will get that credit, no questions asked.  And as far as complaints about Eagle, I have none.  I have read some of the stories of how bad their delivery service is.  It all depends on where you are, and who you manage to get for a driver.  So if you can't decide what TV to buy, you can't go wrong with this one.

Reviews.Title: u cant beat the price and quality of this tv
Reviews.Author: Najib Maiwand "Jay Maiwand"
Reviews.Content: toshiba 37" is an excellent tv..i bought this nice tv in december 2007 and im happy with it.i really recommend to whom, looking for nice price and quality..ok

Reviews.Title: This HDTV rocks!
Reviews.Author: S. Miller
Reviews.Content: This is my first HDTV purchase.  After days of research on-line I decided to go with the Toshiba 37HL67. I couldn't be more pleased!  Right out of the box, it has an awesome picture. (I did have to tone down the brightness a little.) The colors look fantastic and the Black is very good. The tuner is amazing, even with an old "rabbit ears" antenna it managed to pick up most HD channels. I have a new Philips amplified HDTV antenna on the way. I really like the "favorites" channel surfing capabilities and the sound from the set is awesome!  A fantastic HDTV!

Reviews.Title: Toshiba REGZA 37HL67 37"
Reviews.Author: Carole Walters
Reviews.Content: Very satisfied.  Met all expectations.  Had no problems with install or hook up.  Great picture.  Would highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: worth every penny
Reviews.Author: Michael J. Simpson "tech junky"
Reviews.Content: Packaged well.Easy to understand directions.Simple setup.Good looking.Great picture and sound quality.I was so impressed that i bought a second one for another room.

Reviews.Title: great :)
Reviews.Author: J. ramirez
Reviews.Content: I bought my tv and it was very prompt in delivery as well as a great shopping experience..

Reviews.Title: Great TV
Reviews.Author: Matthew Cervi
Reviews.Content: This is my first LCD and I couldn't be happier with it.  I spent 3 months researching TV's before settling on this one.  This set has excellent contrast with good black levels.  A lot of the cheaper, or even similar priced, LCD's have very gray blacks.  Be prepared to spend some time tweaking the picture settings for each input to get exactly what you want.The glossy black bezel looks really nice in my living room, but keep your kids away from it or you'll be wiping off smudges all the time.  The remote could probably be a little better, but I'm going to get a universal remote soon anyway.  I now have 5 remotes and it has become too confusing for the rest of the family to use.

Reviews.Title: Peice of crap
Reviews.Author: Steven Hone
Reviews.Content: I purchased this tv 3 years ago.  After two and a half years I had trouble with a cold start.  Then it would not start unless I plugged and unplugged it multiple times.  I found people on the internet with the same issue and they said to take if the power saving setting and always keep it plugged in.  Well this worked until I need to move it.  When I plugged it in I spend a couple of hours trying to start it, no luck.  There is a yellow light on the front that just keeps blinking 3 times in sequence.  Found out this is a common problem and requires that the power board mostly needs to be replaced.  Of course Toshiba knows of no problem with this model.  This is the first tv I have ever had that stopped working.  Goggle this model for problems.  KEEP AWAY, DO NOT BUY ANY TOSHIBA PRODUCTS.I finally took it to a repair person and he just updated some firm ware in the TV.  Cost just $50.00.  I was going to throw it a way.  Best $50 I have spent.

Reviews.Title: Great Deal!!!
Reviews.Author: Thomas William Vandry
Reviews.Content: This is a great deal ...great picture and very light , easy to move ,set up and user friendly..great product and very good price..

Reviews.Title: Great TV with an even better price
Reviews.Author: B. Helfand "Benh43"
Reviews.Content: I researched for months before buying this TV.  The Toshiba's are just as good as any Samsung or Sony but half the price. The picture is very nice. I play XBOX 360 as well as Wii on it and the graphics with both on this TV are awesome. My couch is about 7 feet away from the TV and any bigger than the 37" would be to big.

Reviews.Title: Nice TV
Reviews.Author: Ment "Ment"
Reviews.Content: Amazon did a great job with my purchase and delivery.The picture is what I expected after reviews that I read on this web page and others.I am hook into Dishnetwork without HD and the picture is fine.I had some old rabbit ears down in my basement and hooked those up and pulled in Hd and digital over the air-nice picture! Then bought the Starship Enterprise from the shack and, it's remote control for an indoor antennna.I am pleased. Weather can effect it like wind depending on where the TV station is located.Might go to outdoor antenna after research but you can get true HD over the air and it is nice.

Reviews.Title: Toshiba 37" TV
Reviews.Author: James P. Fallon "jpfallon"
Reviews.Content: The price was as good as you can get and the expedited delivery cost only 12 more than regular delivery. Couldn't be better!

Reviews.Title: Toshiba REGZA 37HL67 37" 720p LCD HDTV
Reviews.Author: Sissy Jen "music mama"
Reviews.Content: This is a really great TV to have. The sound quality, the picture quality are excellent. We should have bought one sooner. A+++++

Reviews.Title: Just-a-Regza
Reviews.Author: Benjamin L. Campbell "bencbell"
Reviews.Content: My first LCD and it's great. I even bought a tilt wall mount and got it all hooked up in the master bedroom. Very satisfied with this product!

Reviews.Title: Good Value
Reviews.Author: Anthony Jacob Weaver "BigDogs"
Reviews.Content: I purchased this TV about 1 month ago.  I find it is very easy to navigate the settings and the set looks great aesthetically.  The picture is excellent with HD feed, the built in tuner also works well with just some old school rabbit ears I've had since 2000.  I would recommend this TV.

Reviews.Title: Nice TV, great price
Reviews.Author: Ryan M. Przybilla
Reviews.Content: Got this TV about a month ago.  The HD programming looks great - standard definition content is a little grainy (which isn't too surprising).  It was easy to hook up and the menus were easy to navigate.

Reviews.Title: Toshiba REGZA 37 inch LCD TVv
Reviews.Author: Robert Fulton "Steamboat Bob"
Reviews.Content: We have had it for three weeks and so far are very happy with the TV. Even the SD channels bring us terrific pictures with one exception. Our local CBS affiliate has had rather poor quality during the NCAA basketball playoffs. Interestingly, our other local channels carried by DISH come through much better. (We understand DISH is not yet prepared to carry these local channels in HD.) The sound quality is very good. Delivery was on time and the delivery man was exceptionally helpful in setting up the TV and making sure it worked OK.

Reviews.Title: great tv
Reviews.Author: Sam ONeill
Reviews.Content: This is a great tv. I think it has good picture for standard definition as that's what I have. I hope to upgrade to HD soon but it looks really good now.  It's great that it has many different connections, 2 composite, 2 component and 3 HDMI. Best TV in it's catagory.

Reviews.Title: love this TV!
Reviews.Author: luv2ride
Reviews.Content: I've had this TV for almost 6 months and it has been perfect! Beautiful picture, great sound, and turns on quickly! Definitely a great purchase.

Reviews.Title: Toshiba 37" REGZA
Reviews.Author: Jewelry fan
Reviews.Content: I'm very pleased with this purchase.  Beautiful picture and great sound at a fair price.

Reviews.Title: Love it
Reviews.Author: M. Denis Hill "whidbeypix"
Reviews.Content: This is my first HDTV. At the time I didn't want to pay the premium for 1080p but did want an excellent quality TV. I'm no pixel peeper, so all I can say is that this works great and looks great.

Reviews.Title: PLEASE READ BEFORE BUYING THIS JUNK!
Reviews.Author: PorscheBob "PorscheBob"
Reviews.Content: You have been reading reviews from people who JUST BOUGHT the TV! Here's the one you NEED to read from an owner of 2.5 years. It is not a matter of IF the LCD screen will go out, just a matter of WHEN. When being most likely within 1-3 years max. Toshiba KNEW when they sourced the LCD screens for this TV that they were faulty and had serious issues. Sony has a class action suit against them right now for doing the same thing. They went ahead and bought them in bulk for a song and installed them anyway to save money and increase profits while staying competitive in price. Not only does the TV blow up before dust can comfortably settle on it, any deep bass sound rattles the housing with a loud buzz. The picture is not all that terrific compared to decent, reliable brands (Hitachi, Samsung). All in all, you would be better advised to pile your money up in your driveway and burn it than buy this piece of inferior crap. Oh, the best part? When the TV guy comes and hauls it in to diagnose what I just told you is going to happen...the cost of the LCD screen replacement 1s over $1000 alone! That's right...not only do the low life SOBs at Toshiba continue to sell the inferior displays, they price the replacement parts higher than the original cost of the whole set! Add $250 into that for labor and you have a potential $1250 pile of Japanese garbage (plus original cost) sitting on a workbench in a TV shop on it's way to polluting a landfill somewhere.I have no axe to grind against Toshiba...you simply buy any of their products including the highly touted Regza line at your own risk. They are absolute 100% TRASH and guaranteed NOT to last 1/4 the time of other brands. All the above IMHO.

Reviews.Title: Toshiba Regza 37in
Reviews.Author: Rosemary Vivinetto "RosemaryNJ"
Reviews.Content: At this point we are very happy with our Toshiba.  We do not have digital cable to date and the HDTV channels come in very clearly and sharp with regular cable.

Reviews.Title: Great TV
Reviews.Author: Anubhav Shrivastava
Reviews.Content: I bought this TV couple of weeks back. It was shipped on time and reached on time. They did not install the TV or tested it (which made me little concered). But TV was in perfect condition when I installed it. I have had no troubles so far. Great Buy.

Reviews.Title: Excellent Choice
Reviews.Author: R. Christensen
Reviews.Content: I was very happy with my purchase.  The TV was delivered on time and in perfect condition.  The shipping company was excellent, the quality of the TV great, and I am very happy with it.  I was told by a person who is an expert on video equipment that Toshiba are very reliable and have excellent quality.  I hung it on the wall in about 30 minutes and now enjoy laying in bed and watching HD TV.....Football never looked so good!

Reviews.Title: Broken Right Out Of The Box!
Reviews.Author: Domonic Adams "1 Of A Kind"
Reviews.Content: This LCD brought me nothing but problems, It took them a week to get it to me and i took it out the box and it looked great however i plugged it in and all hell broke loose. The screen was broken, i couldn't see anything. When i wanted to get a replacement becuase i got it for a very low price i couldn't get it.Amazon warehouse only gives refunds on LCD's not replacements. And no telling when i will get the refund or when they will pick it up.Highly Disappointed!

Reviews.Title: REGZA meets claims
Reviews.Author: Joe Engineer "Joe"
Reviews.Content: The TV was delivered exactly as announced and the deliverymen expected to wait for unpacking to check to see if it was OK.  They were helpful.

Reviews.Title: Toshiba Regza 40RF35RU
Reviews.Author: James F. Gregory "T. Wolf"
Reviews.Content: I have cable which says they broadcast in HD but can only get 480i as signal designation.  Picture varies from unacceptable to moderately good but is never comparable to what I see on my neighbors plasma TV.  Also find remote control is spastic.  When it refuses to perform I have found that a few rapps on the arm of my chair restores operation for an undetermined amount of time.Picture quality may be, to some extent, an issue of quality of signal but the remote is a manufacture's problem.

Reviews.Title: BUYER BEWARE!!!  TERRIBLE CUSTOMER SERVICE
Reviews.Author: Jon Eis
Reviews.Content: I have a similar Toshiba 47LZ196 that I paid $3499.99 for in Dec. 2006 that is just under 1 year and 2.5 months old and the panel ($3400.00) crapped out on me.  After being informed by multiple Toshiba reps that I was in the window to receive assistance I was informed NOTHING would be covered and I was responsible for the cost of the part and repairs.  What a joke for a higher end flat panel.  One year and almost $4000.00 down the old crapper.  Such a shame since I really liked that tv.

Reviews.Title: Screen cracked on arrival
Reviews.Author: R. S. Gabriel "rg"
Reviews.Content: Screen cracked on arrival. It was very difficult to obtain answer from Tiger Direct as to whether the TV would be replaced or whether I would have to obtain a refund from amazon. In the end amazon was prompt in organising a refund.
